meanings.definition: A deadline is a time or date by which something must be completed or submitted.
meanings.sent1: The teacher reminded the students about the deadlining for their homework assignment.
meanings.sent2: The team was rushing to meet the project deadlining set by the client.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have its own deadlining for when it wanted to be fed.
meanings.sent4: The deadlining for the marathon was fast approaching, motivating the runners to train harder.
meanings.sent5: The deadlining for the contest created a sense of urgency among the participants.

meanings.definition: To deadline is to set or impose a deadline for a task or project.
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to deadlining the completion date for the new product launch.
meanings.sent2: She always deadlines her assignments to ensure they are finished on time.
meanings.sent3: The students joked that the professor must love to deadlining their exams.
meanings.sent4: The coach deadlining the practice schedule to prepare the team for the upcoming match.
meanings.sent5: He tends to deadlining his goals to keep himself motivated and focused.

meanings.definition: Deadlining is the act of working towards or meeting a deadline.
meanings.sent1: The team's dedication to deadlining impressed the project manager.
meanings.sent2: She showed great skill in deadlining the completion of the complex task.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's deadlining to gather nuts before winter was quite efficient.
meanings.sent4: The deadlining of the construction crew ensured the building was completed on time.
meanings.sent5: His deadlining of the report was commendable, finishing it well before the due date.
